sentences.en: Due a very low birthrate, however, this trend will reverse within a decade or two.
sentences.cn: 但是由于出生率逐年走低, 这种增长趋势将会在接下来的10年或20年内出现扭转.

sentences.en: I have a personal theory , though : the more sexist the country, the lower the birthrate.
sentences.cn: 各个富国正处于人口危机的开端, 出生率开始降至更替水平以下.

sentences.en: In our nation, birthrate is much higher in country than in city.
sentences.cn: 我国农村的出生率要远远高于城市.

sentences.en: People objected to the idea that it is because of drop of birthrate.
sentences.cn: 人们反对这一看法来自于出生率的下降.

sentences.en: So even if the birthrate should rise somewhat, little expansion is possible for secondary school enrollments.
sentences.cn: 因此,即使出生率有所上升, 中小学入学人数不可能有大的增长.

sentences.en: The birthrate in France has been declining for several years.
sentences.cn: 近几年来,法国的出生率一直在下降.

sentences.en: The birthrate in the city has been decreasing.
sentences.cn: 该市的出生率一直持续下降.

sentences.en: The birthrate in this city is increasing at a ratio a thousand every year.
sentences.cn: 这个城市的出生率以每年千分之0.6的比率上升.

sentences.en: The birthrate is on the decline.
The birthrate is on the decrease.
The child birthrate in that area has doubled.
sentences.cn: 该地区的婴儿出生率已经增加了一倍.

sentences.en: The new birthrate has decreased from last year's.
sentences.cn: 新出生率与去年相比有所下降.

sentences.en: The problem is a hangover from the high birthrate of the 50's.
sentences.cn: 这问题是五十年代高出生率的遗留物.

words.tran_cn: 生育的；生育用的；分娩用的

trans.tran_en: the number of births for every 100 or every 1,000 people in a particular year in a particular place
